---
title: "Norski Cup"
---


Modeled after the NHL Stanley cup, the Norskie cup was created in 2004 by Jim Hanson. 
The Norskie cup is awarded to each division’s championship game winner and engraved at the end of each season with each division’s champion player’s names.


:::{.center}
![](../images/general/NorskieCup.png)
:::

The Norskie cup is named after Jim & Joe Hanson’s  late father, Philip “Norskie” Hanson. Philip served in the Army Air Corps as a radio operator in Southeast Asia and was part of the D-Day +1 landing on the island of Saipan. Philip past away in 2017.


:::{.center}
